
The CEO encrypted a password with RSA, but both primes are Blum integers. Crack it before rivals do! Ciphertext: 1502562233216823312795153792381452930553148357051298014563063890487198148228679172549371412481500599915309210262646405015387855355624720368963616673470300

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{k8jqga3c}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1502562233216823312795153792381452930553148357051298014563063890487198148228679172549371412481500599915309210262646405015387855355624720368963616673470300
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=4648079338616365684434467258488471383218896053731450552945544504827122804103729875519702207762964174879537343428309796903436706783785117330674837489803021, e=3168552213896764985438271091144311337921765218378004219278049525615687920478329756659925915201574366426343223981511639171076657518079442621769637789027093
The lower 104 bits of p are: 15015483680064914126803874368340910843
